args: So this is the Mistholt I've heard such\ntales about. I can scarce believe so\nmany rare plants grow here.
It's a veritable treasure trove of herbs\nand the like; I'm truly jealous that Luca\ngets to live here.
Crap! Crap crap craaaaap!\nGotta hide, gotta... Muh?
Sylas? Is that you? *poke*\nHey, it IS you!
I will thank you not to poke me, Luca.\nAnd I see you are the same as ever.
Hey, so long story short here, I'm gonna\nhide up in that tree while you try to\ntrick my sister. Okay? Okay! Hnnngh!
I'm certain I have no idea what\nyou are talking about.
Where are you, you blockhead?!\n...Whoa! Sylas!
Hello, Sarisse. Do you need something?
Just to find and murder my brick-stupid\nbrother for eating all my apples again.
I went to teach him a lesson,\nand the jerk took off on me!
Do you know where he scuttled off to?
I'm afraid I haven't seen him.
By the way, Sarisse, are you familiar\nwith the method used for catching\nan Alberian beetle?

If one wants to capture an Alberian beetle,
one needs merely to kick the tree it resides
in as hard as possible to have it come
tumbling to the ground. Observe! *kick*
Now THIS is a rarity! Instead of a beetle,\nwe had a Luca fall out.
I tricked her once, which seemed enough.\nNow then, don't you think you owe\nyour dear sister an apology?
I guess it makes sense you'd be hiding\nin the same place as a stupid bug.
Oh, uh, Sarisse! Heeeeey, girl!\nFancy running into you here!
You are the biggest butthead of a brother\na girl could ask for. Hiiiii-YA!
So now that I've dealt with that little\nissue, what are you doing here, Sylas?
I've been curious for some time as to what\nmanner of plants grow in this area.
It also seemed like a chance to visit\nsome familiar faces. Speaking of which,\nI brought this aromatic as a souvenir.
Ooh, is this a new one you made?\nExciting! I'm gonna light it up\nthe minute I get home.
Isn't that nice, Luca? Sarisse seems\nto be in a much better mood.
I would've been happier if you\njust tricked her. Uuurgh...
Buuuut since you're here, you're more than\nwelcome to come kick it at the castle.
We'll have Cleo make you some tea\nas thanks for the aromatic.
Well, assuming Cleo is all right with the\narrangement, that sounds lovely.
I'll lead the way. Follow me!
...So this is the Halidom, eh?\nThe rumors do not do it justice.
Don't strut around like you had anything\nto do with it, dope!
Regardless, I know a little something\nyou're just gonna LOVE. Come with me!
Is this...a vegetable garden?!\nIn the castle courtyard?!
Sure is! Veggies, fruits, weird plants\nyou name it, we grow it.
Hello, Luca. And you as well, Sarisse.\nIf I'm not mistaken, the person currently\naccompanying you is...
That's my buddy, Sylas.\nWhat're you two up to?
You cultivate edible herbs? Delightful!\nIf it's acceptable, I'd like to take a look.
Fine by me. I'm also cultivating other\nrare medicinal herbs, if that's something\nthat holds your interest.
Sooo...rain check on the tea, then?
Yes, yes. We'll do that later.
Ha! He's just as tunnel-visioned about that\nstuff as he was back in the day.
I had him pegged as a level-headed type,\nbut he might have more Luca in him\nthan I first suspected.
Huh, you think so? Oh, say, can you bring\ntea for three to my room later?
Very well. I'll brew something excellent\nwith the herbs we're picking.
...This herbal tea was made with the\nrosemary from your garden, yes?
I can taste and smell the quality of the\nherb, as well as the care and skill that\nwent into tending the garden.
Again, why are YOU bragging about this?
Nevertheless...*sniff* Oh man, your\naromatic smells sooo good, Sylas!
Yeah, your smelly dealies have always\nmade me feel oddly relaxed.
Aromatics aren't just about enjoying the\nscent. The natural powers of plants often\nhave a rejuvenating effect on tired bodies.
However, I'd someday like to produce an\naromatic that heals not only fatigue,\nbut also the ravages of illne...
Good heavens! Was that an explosion?!
Oh, don't worry about that.\nHappens all the time around here.
Probably Kleimann's lab going out of\ncontrol again, or maybe one of Sinoa's\nexperiments getting all 'splody.
Sure do. You're always walkin' into rooms\nfilled with one egghead or another.
Research and a garden within the walls,\nand a jungle of rare plants without...
How's that, buddy? You kinda did a weird\nmumble, trail-off thing there.
Luca, where is the lord of this castle now?\nThe one called {player_name}.
He's out exterminating fiends.\nOughta be back soon, though.
Well, when he returns, I would very much\nlike to make a request of him.
I'm back, everyone! ...Oh, hello, Luca.\nEr, did you need something?
Sorry to jump on you the second you walk\nacross the moat, but my buddy here needs\nto pick your brain for a few.
Hey, this is your childhood friend Sylas!\nI'm glad you came to see us.
My thanks again for your recent help,\nPrince, but I fear I have a rather\nimpudent request to foist upon you.
You want to stay in the Halidom?
I have a scientific objective, you see.\nI aim to create a healing aromatic\nthat cures illness as well as fatigue.

To that end, I require a great number
of components, including aromatic herbs,
medicinal herbs, and various vegetable
oils for compounding.
I've been conducting my research in my\nvillage thus far, but have been unable to\nobtain all the components I require.

However, your castle is surrounded by the
Mistholtwhich contains a trove of wild
herbsand your garden also boasts a
rather exceptional bounty.
In other words, the Halidom is the\nperfect environment for your research.
I don't mean to lodge here free of charge,\nof course. Poor though it may be, I shall\noffer the full extent of my aid in battle.
So I implore you, please allow me to\nconduct my research here.
I, uh, implore you as well! I mean,\nthis guy may not be as tough as me,\nbut he's as skilled as they come.
That's enough help from you, Luca.
Heh. Well, you've all convinced menot\nthat I needed a great deal of convincing.\nYou're more than welcome here, Sylas.
I owe you my gratitude, Prince.
And hey, if you need a science lackey to\nhelp out with the beakers or whatever,\nI'm your man!
Thank you, Luca. This may open new paths\nforward, and even save countless lives.
